intro: Daphnidium bibracteatum, commonly known as the two-bract daphnidium, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces two bracts beneath each flower, which are modified leaves that serve to protect the floral buds.
